page.title: 01Esk Valley and Danby Beacon
page.content: the area is the beautiful deep River Esk Valley overlooked by Danby Beacon (299m) 16kms west of whitby within the National park. A fertile narrow valley floor is primarily farmed grassland for the dairy and beef herds. with steep grazing on the upper valley sides. Populated a few small farms and one hamlet called Houlsyke. The settlement goes back to Napoleonic times as a warning beacon site but is now a tourist route during summer. No amenities apart from one chapel and a railway service from Whitby to Middlesborough.
